parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "flux",
  "details": {
    "module_path": "/usr/global/tools/flux/blueos_3_ppc64le_ib/modulefiles",
    "module_load": "pmi-shim flux/c0.26.0-s0.16.0",
    "jsrun_arguments": {
      "nrs": 4,
      "rs_per_host": 1,
      "tasks_per_rs": 1,
      "c": "ALL_CPUS",
      "g": "ALL_GPUS",
      "bind": "none",
      "smpiargs": "-disable_gpu_hooks"
    },
    "pmix_mca_gds": "^ds12,ds21",
    "ld_library_path": "/usr/tce/packages/cuda/cuda-10.1.243/lib64"
  }
}
```

This script utilizes the `flux` application for parallel computing. It utilizes modules for loading `pmi-shim` and `flux` with specific versions. The script runs `jsrun` to launch 4 ranks of the `flux` process, binding to all CPUs and GPUs on each node with specific settings like `bind=none` and `smpiargs="-disable_gpu_hooks"`. It also configures the `PMIX_MCA_gds` environment variable for inter-node communication. Additionally, it utilizes `flux` commands for obtaining local URIs and setting up communication channels, preparing for further analysis with `flux proxy` and `flux kvs dir`.
